records.location_details: A group of 16 migrants left Bodrum, Türkiye in the direction of Kos Island in a rigid hull inflatable boat that was later intercepted by a Greek vessel. Migrants were forced to board the HCG vessel, beaten, and belongings confiscated. They were transferred back to their rubber boat, towed, and the boat was damaged with a knife, rendering it immobile. They were left adrift at sea and eventually rescued by a Turkish Coast Guard vessel. The location and circumstances of the alleged interception of the migrant boat in the vicinity of Kos Island, in Greek territorial waters, and the irregular return to Turkish territorial waters could not be independently corroborated.
records.where_clear: Sea area near Kos Island, Greek territorial waters, close to Turkish territorial waters (Bodrum, Türkiye)
records.uncertainty_note: The location and circumstances of the alleged interception of the migrant boat in the vicinity of Kos Island, in Greek territorial waters, and the irregular return to Turkish territorial waters could not be independently corroborated by the Fundamental Rights Office.
records.context_note: A group of 16 migrants left Bodrum, Türkiye, intercepted by Greek vessel, forced to board HCG vessel, beaten, belongings confiscated, transferred back to rubber boat, towed, boat damaged, left adrift, rescued by Turkish Coast Guard.
records.evidence_quote: a group of 16 migrants left Bodrum, Türkiye in the direction of Kos Island in a rigid hull inflatable boat that was later intercepted by a Greek vessel and was instructed to wait next to it. After one hour a Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) vessel approached and forced the migrants to board the HCG vessel, where they were beaten, and all their personal belongings were confiscated.

records.location_details: A group of 70 migrants left Bodrum, Türkiye on a sailboat in the direction of Leros Island. Close to Leros Island, the sailboat was stopped by a Hellenic Coast Guard boat. Migrants were forced to board a larger HCG vessel (CPV 930), beaten, and belongings confiscated. After sailing for about one hour, migrants were transferred onto three life rafts and abandoned at sea. They were rescued by a Turkish Coast Guard vessel. The migrant sailboat first contacted an NGO at location 37°07'04.3"N 26°57'03.3"E. The concrete location provided by the NGO could not be independently corroborated, but based on visible shore and HCG assets in video, the Office is certain the video was shot in Greek territorial waters, possibly in the vicinity of the provided location.
records.where_clear: Sea area near Leros Island, Greek territorial waters, close to Turkish territorial waters (Bodrum, Türkiye)
records.uncertainty_note: The concrete location provided by the NGO could not be independently corroborated... possibly in the vicinity of the location provided by the NGO.
records.context_note: A group of 70 migrants left Bodrum, Türkiye on a sailboat, stopped by HCG boat near Leros, forced to board HCG vessel, beaten, belongings confiscated, transferred onto three life rafts, abandoned at sea, rescued by Turkish Coast Guard.
records.evidence_quote: On 07/04/2024, during their second attempt to reach Greece, the migrant left Bodrum, Türkiye on a sailboat in the direction of Leros Island as part of a group of 70. Close to Leros Island the sailboat was stopped by a Hellenic Coast Guard boat and had to wait until a bigger HCG vessel arrived.
